metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17460 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient data validation in filesystem URIs in Google Chrome prior to 68.0.3440.75 allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contents of the Omnibox (URL bar) via a crafted domain name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17460` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
